qas.question: When did India and Pakistan fight in Punjab?
What is Kahuta an important location for?
Where does Punjab have major military bases?
When did India and Pakistan begin serious peace talks?
When did Punjab fight against India?
When did trade between people become common?
What is the name of India's nuclear program?

context: Punjab witnessed major battles between the armies of India and Pakistan in the wars of <a0_0><b5_0>1965 and 1971<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Since the <b6_0>1990s<b6_0/> Punjab hosted several key sites of <a1_0>Pakistan's nuclear program<a1_0/> such as <b9_0>Kahuta<b9_0/>. It also hosts major military bases such as at <a2_0>Sargodha and Rawalpindi<a2_0/>. The peace process between India and Pakistan, which began in earnest in <a3_0><b8_0>2004<b8_0/><a3_0/>, has helped pacify the situation. Trade and people-to-people contacts through <b7_0>the Wagah border<b7_0/> are now starting to become common. Indian <a4_0>Sikh pilgrims<a4_0/> visit holy sites such as Nankana Sahib.
